SPECIAL NOTES: 
The Bard levels assume you have (or you can't afford) no access to a permanent +2 Charisma item so they are at 18th & 28th level in order to achieve even UMD ranks. If you do have the option of getting a simple +2 Charisma item though, then you can move them earlier to the 17th & 27th levels accordingly. 

COMBAT OPTIONS: 
A dual-Wielder will always get the most out of his abilities when performing full attacks but you do have the option to use Knockdown against Mages & Rogues in order to disrupt their attacks. Whirlwind attack is useful when facing foes that hide with sanctuary or kobold commando's for example (HiPS) for you will be able to hurt them even if they are under these conditions. Don't forget that you have also Expertise, activate the feat in tough fights in order to get a significant boost in your armour class, you should still be able to hit your opponennts while having that feat active.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Any way you can post a lvl 40 version of this build? TY.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I'd suggest 1 more Bard skill dump at level 38, and 9 more Weapon Master levels. Take Great Strength at levels 33, 36, and 39, and you'll end up at 32 Strength. You'll get 3 more AB from the Strength, 3 more from the 9 WM levels, and 5 more BAB from the 10 epic character levels. For the three WM feats, maybe IKD, Toughness, and Epic Toughness.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content: you can't take ikd or toughness as wm bonus feats. you're going to want to not take ewf with fighter bonus feat and take it on wm feat as fighter bonus feat has a bigger selection.   depending on how much ab you need, you might consider stopping wm at 19 or 22 and take fighter and take Dev crit (need to count the feats).

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Yeah, I was dubious about the suggested feat selection myself and was going to run a mock-up to quantify, but wondered maybe Empyre was selecting some as general feats with WM at those levels. Dunno w/o checking. 

Anyhoo... not to be a royal PITA (though it is a birthright my father would attest to if he were still alive), but shouldn't recommendations about Level 40 epic builds go in either Unfinalized or the Level 40 section?  I mean there is some intrinsic organization implied with all these subforums and it sort of derails Valerfor's original concept, no?  I suspect campgod was really expecting to see a discrete Level 40 version posted elsewhere (perhaps by Valerfor since it would be a variant of sorts on this theme).  That would be a more logical residence IMO.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I was making an incorrect assumption of what feats a WM could take. I should have checked. I guess that means that you would be stuck with 3 Epic Toughness feats.

I was leaving it for Valerfor to make and post the actual level 40 build in the correct subforum because it is his build that is being expanded, and it would presumptuous of me to post an expanded version myself, but I didn't want campgod's question to go unanswered, so I made suggestions.

Because you already have Improved Crit., you would need 5 feats to get Dev. Crit.: Power  Attack, Cleave, Great Cleave, Overwhelming Crit., and Dev. Crit. If you made all ten additional levels Fighter, you could get those feats, but you wouldn't get the +3 AB from 9 WM levels, nor an additional Bard skill dump. Another alternative would be to take 2 Fighter, 2 Bard, and 6 WM, and sacrifice 2 Great Strength feats to get Dev. Crit.

posts.author: Reblar
posts.content: Was trying to find the best place to put 3 levels of bard back-to-back to make it work on Arelith, anyone got a recommendation?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: There is a way to retain the ab of this build intact even with more bard levels. Simply change the split to (fighter 10/ bard 4/ wm 16) taking the three first levels pre-epic and the last one at your 27th level. You will have the same number of epic feats but one pre-epic feat less so you must cut something (easiest is the exotic weapons proficiency) and you are set. The best place to take those three bard levels would be right after your 10th wm one, meaning you take 7 fighter levels then all ten of your wm levels then your three mandatory bard levels then progress normally from there.
